subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 18, 2007

TOP STORIESSenators Press CIA To Release 9/11 Report
A bipartisan group of senators is pushing legislation that would force the CIA to release a report on the terrorist attacks
                        of Sept. 11, 2001. The agency is the only counterterrorism federal office that has not made a version of its probe public. More...
• Immigration Deal Faces Uncertain Future
                     					| Watch• 2 ABC Journalists Killed In Iraq
                     					| Watch• Gaza Falls Deeper Into ChaosU.S."Bloomberg Gun Giveaway" Draws Crowd
A Virginia gun-rights advocacy group drew a well-armed crowd of more than 200 people by raffling off two free firearms. The
                        "Bloomberg Gun Giveaway" was held to protest New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg's lawsuit against two Virginia gun shops.
                         More...
• Anheuser-Busch Pulls "Spykes"• Woman Survives "Internal Decapitation"
                     					| Watch• Immigration Deal Faces Uncertain Future
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldGaza Falls Deeper Into Chaos
Israeli planes continue to pound Hamas targets, and Fatah and Hamas gunmen clash on the streets of Gaza City. Hamas rockets
                        continued to fall on the Israeli border town of Sderot, to which Israel said it had to respond. More...
• 2 ABC Journalists Killed In Iraq
                     					| Watch• Deadly Blast At Historic Indian Mosque• Russian Opposition Leaders Kept From Rally• More StoriesPoliticsImmigration Deal Faces Uncertain Future
A bipartisan immigration deal that would grant legal status to millions of people in the country unlawfully is drawing criticism
                        from across the political spectrum. The deal will face intense scrutiny and debate in Congress next week. More...Watch: Immigration Law Deal
• Dems Seek No-Confidence Vote On Gonzales• "Bloomberg Gun Giveaway" Draws Crowd• Wolfowitz On His Way Out At World Bank• More StoriesHealthAnheuser-Busch Pulls "Spykes"
Anheuser-Busch is to stop selling an alcoholic beverage that quickly became a magnet for states' attorney generals and campaign
                        groups against underage drinking. The beverage giant says criticism that "Spykes" was targeting kids was "unfounded". More...
• Prescription Drug Use Up In Teen Girls• 7 In 10 Puzzled By Slew Of Cancer Messages• What's In A Name? Face Shape, Maybe• More StoriesSciTechArmy Lab Uses Sports Science On Soldiers
Fort Campbell has opened its Injury Prevention and Performance Enhancement Laboratory, a first-of-its-kind military lab designed
                        to help determine how soldiers get hurt and develop programs to prevent injuries. More...
• Ocean May Be Absorbing Less Carbon Dioxide• Need Free Tech Support For Your Computer?• Troubled Kids, At-Risk Animals Bond
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessMeet "Generation Plastic"
The average collge senior has more than $3,000 in credit card debt and graduates with at least four credit cards. As Nancy
                        Cordes reports, marketers are getting even more aggressive, pitching cards to kids as young as 3. More...Watch: College Grads In Plastic Debt
• Need Free Tech Support For Your Computer?• Fed: Mortgage Defaults Won't Hurt Economy• More Hitting The Road This Memorial Day• More StoriesEntertainmentLindsay Lohan Avoids Theft Rap
A woman claims that Lindsay Lohan stole some of her clothes, but prosecutors in Los Angeles say there's no evidence to prove
                        her case. More...Watch: 'Georgia Rule' Premieres In NY
• Bo Diddley's Condition Improves
                     					| Watch• It's Sex, Not Singing, That Sells
                     					| Watch• Fan Charged With Stalking Sandra Bullock• More StoriesOpinionSpeed It Up
CBS's Dick Meyer sees no good reason to wait until November 2008 to elect a new president. Are you really and truly
                        looking forward to another 10 months of primary campaigning and then 11 more months of a general campaign? More...
• Clinton A Vexing Foe For Opponents
                     					| Watch• Dumbed-Down Intelligence
                     					| Watch• The Old Time Hypocrisy Hour
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Mary Lou Quinlan: Just Ask A Woman ... About Motherhood
The Early Show contributor Mary Lou Quinlan ruminates on the stresses faced by today's mothers. Why do we put
                        so much pressure on ourselves to be Super Mom? Can any mother ever feel she's done a "perfect" job?  More...Watch: Women And Beauty Products

Immigration Bill: Amnesty?A bipartisan group, including two Bush cabinet members, finalized an immigration bill. Critics are calling it amnesty. Sharyl
                                    Attkisson reports.
